messages.content:
You are a research assistant with access to a memory system. Your task is to answer the user's question by searching and retrieving information from memory.

Instructions:
- Use memory_search to find relevant information for the question.
- Use memory_retrieve to get full document details when you need specifics.
- Use memory_capabilities to understand what the memory system offers, including available search modes, filter fields, and any extra tools.
- If extra tools are available (e.g. batch_retrieve), prefer them for efficiency — they can fetch multiple documents in one call instead of one call per document.
- Synthesize your findings into a clear, concise answer.
- IMPORTANT: For each claim in your answer, cite the supporting episode using the format [ref_id]. Every factual statement must have at least one citation.
- If you cannot find sufficient information, say so clearly.
- You have a limited number of turns and tool calls. Use them efficiently.
What was the CDN cache hit rate reported on February 1st?

messages.reasoning: We need to answer: "What was the CDN cache hit rate reported on February 1st?" Likely there is a document about CDN metrics on that date. Use memory_search.

messages.content:
{"ref_id": "cascading_failure_01_ep_018", "text": "## 2024-02-01 Daily Operations Summary

### Endpoint Performance
- /checkout: REQUESTS 145200 | p50: 175ms p95: 470ms p99: 860ms | err: 2.13% (3100 errors) | success: 97.87%
- /fraud_check: REQUESTS 144700 | p50: 125ms p95: 350ms p99: 600ms | err: 0.45% (650 errors) | success: 99.55%
- /geo_lookup: REQUESTS 142400 | p50: 230ms p95: 500ms p99: 650ms | err: 0.22% (320 errors) | success: 99.78%
- /auth: REQUESTS 189200 | p50: 40ms p95: 104ms p99: 185ms | err: 0.11% (210 errors) | success: 99.89%
- /product_catalog: REQUESTS 254100 | p50: 50ms p95: 150ms p99: 270ms | err: 0.11% (280 errors) | success: 99.89%
- /search: REQUESTS 220300 | p50: 70ms p95: 188ms p99: 325ms | err: 0.17% (370 errors) | success: 99.83%
- /recommendations: REQUESTS 178700 | p50: 86ms p95: 245ms p99: 415ms | err: 0.2% (360 errors) | success: 99.8%

### Infrastructure
- gateway-01: CPU 66% | Mem 76% | Disk 62% | Conns: 4380 | Net: 635/760 Mbps
- gateway-02: CPU 63% | Mem 74% | Disk 61% | Conns: 4205 | Net: 618/738 Mbps
- service-b-01: CPU 68% | Mem 74% | Disk 59% | Conns: 3780 | Net: 520/612 Mbps
- metrics-db-01: CPU 41% | Mem 76% | Disk 85% | Conns: 335 | Net: 158/190 Mbps

### Connection Pools
- primary: active 200 | idle 0 | waiting 140 | exhaustion: 11 | max: 200 | avg_wait: 135ms
- replica: active 98 | idle 2 | waiting 22 | exhaustion: 3 | max: 100 | avg_wait: 24ms
- third_party_geo: active 60 | idle 0 | waiting 82 | exhaustion: 14 | max: 60 | avg_wait: 170ms

### CDN & Caching
- Hit rate: 92.4% | Bandwidth: 8.4 Gbps | Origin requests: 428900

### Alerts
- [CRITICAL] CONNPOOL-EXHAUSTION on gateway-01: pool=primary events=11 waiting=140
- [CRITICAL] CHECKOUT-ERROR-RATE on gateway-02: error_pct=2.13
- [CRITICAL] UPSTREAM-LATENCY on gateway-01: geo_lookup_p99_ms=650

### Deployments & Changes
- Deployed gateway-config v1.12.6 (timeout adjustments)

### Events
- Gateway timeout for /checkout set to 2.5s
- A/B test 'checkout-v2' at 15% rollout
- Temporary disable of geo-lookup for low-risk countries (feature flag)
- Added new alert: CONNPOOL-EXHAUSTION for third_party_geo

### On-Call
- Shift: D. Kim. 10 pages (CONNPOOL-EXHAUSTION, CHECKOUT-ERROR-RATE). 4 tickets (GW-341 timeouts, CO-804, POOL-565, VEND-90). Status: Mitigating.", "metadata": {}}

function.name: memory_search
function.description: Search the memory system for relevant information. Available search modes: semantic.

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return. Default: 10.

function.name: memory_retrieve
function.description: Retrieve a full document by its reference ID.

ref_id.description: The reference ID of the document to retrieve.

function.name: memory_capabilities
function.description: Get the capability manifest describing what the memory system offers.

function.name: batch_retrieve
function.description: Retrieve multiple full episodes by their reference IDs in a single call. PREFER this over calling memory_retrieve multiple times — it uses only one tool call instead of one per document. After memory_search, pass all ref_ids you want to read to this tool.

ref_ids.description: List of reference IDs to retrieve.
